content.question: Which of the following best describes a purpose of the Establishment Clause?

choices.label: It gives Congress the power to protect civil rights and civil liberties.
It prohibits Congress from establishing a state religion.
It empowers Congress to create a national bank.
It prevents Congress from prohibiting the possession of guns on school grounds.
It grants Congress the power to establish post roads and post offices.

content.answer: It prohibits Congress from establishing a state religion.
